verses.verse: But it displeased <WH3415> Jonah <WH3124> exceedingly, <WH1419> and he was angry. <WH2734>

He prayed <WH6419> to Yahweh, <WH3068> and said, <WH559> "Please, <WH577> Yahweh, <WH3068> wasn't <WH1697> this what I said when I was still in my own country? <WH127> Therefore I hurried <WH1272> to <WH6923> flee to Tarshish, <WH8659> for I knew <WH3045> that you are a gracious <WH2587> God, <WH410> and merciful, <WH7349> slow <WH750> to anger, <WH639> and abundant <WH7227> in loving kindness, <WH2617> and you relent <WH5162> of doing harm. <WH7451>
Therefore now, <WH3068> Yahweh, take, <WH3947> I beg you, <WH5315> my life from me; <WH2896> for it is better for me to die <WH4194> than to live. <WH2416>"
Yahweh <WH3068> said, <WH559> "Is it right <WH3190> for you to be angry? <WH2734>"

Then Jonah <WH3124> went out <WH3318> of the city, <WH5892> and sat <WH3427> on the east side <WH6924> of the city, <WH5892> and there made <WH6213> himself a booth, <WH5521> and sat <WH3427> under it in the shade, <WH6738> until he might see <WH7200> what would become of the city. <WH5892>

Yahweh <WH3068> God <WH430> prepared <WH4487> a vine, <WH7021> and made it to come up <WH5927> over Jonah, <WH3124> that it might be a shade <WH6738> over his head, <WH7218> to deliver <WH5337> him from his discomfort. <WH7451> So he <WH3124> was exceedingly <WH1419> glad <WH8055> because of the vine. <WH7021>
But God <WH430> prepared <WH4487> a worm <WH8438> at <WH5927> dawn <WH7837> the next day, <WH4283> and it chewed <WH5221> on the vine, <WH7021> so that it withered. <WH3001>

It happened, <WH8121> when the sun arose, <WH2224> that God <WH430> prepared <WH4487> a sultry <WH2759> east <WH6921> wind; <WH7307> and the sun <WH8121> beat <WH5221> on Jonah <WH3124>'s head, <WH7218> so that he fainted, <WH5968> and requested <WH7592> for himself <WH5315> that he might die, <WH4191> and said, <WH559> "It is better <WH2896> for me to die <WH4194> than to live. <WH2416>"

God <WH430> said <WH559> to Jonah, <WH3124> "Is it right <WH3190> for you to be angry <WH2734> about the vine? <WH7021>" He said, <WH559> "I am right <WH3190> to be angry, <WH2734> even to death. <WH4194>"

Yahweh <WH3068> said, <WH559> "You have been concerned <WH2347> for the vine, <WH7021> for which you have not labored, <WH5998> neither made it grow; <WH1431> which came up in a night, <WH1121> and perished <WH6> in a night. <WH1121>

Shouldn't <WH2347> I be concerned for Nineveh, <WH5210> that great <WH1419> city, <WH5892> in which are <WH3426> more <WH7235> than one hundred twenty <WH8147> thousand <WH7239> persons <WH120> who can't <WH3045> discern between their right hand <WH3225> and their left hand; <WH8040> and also much <WH7227> livestock? <WH929>"
